comment: This is a difficult class but professor Firment does pretty well teaching it! He's vague, but it's  just because he's not particular. More than willing to help and answer any questions! Attendence is not mandatory and has multiple extra credit opportunities.

The poor guy teaches some of the hardest classes in the Psych program. 2300 and 2301 are basically applied statistics, and 4415 is a biology course. He is a little vague, but he's also really nice and tries to help. A lot of students major in Psych thinking it's all about counseling or Freud. There's a reason the degree is a b.s., not a b.a.

Dr. Firment is great! His teaching methods are  effective & he manages to encorporate humor. At the end of the semester he was very open to suggestions about the course. If he seems vague it's because he has faith in the intelligence of his students. If something seems unclear, just ask.He'll be more than willing to help, he wants you to do well.
Delights in making others feel inferior. Obtuse lecturer, poor writer, smug teacher. Avoid, avoid, avoid.

Dr. Firment thoroughly enjoys teaching.  He is not always crystal clear, but he works very hard to ensure that his students learn the material well. He is always available for help and is remarkably tolerant of poor students because he WANTS them to learn.  He's highly entertaining and kind, as well as brilliant. He isn't easy, but he's good.

A lot of people hate on Dr. Firment saying hes hard and tries to make it hard on students, not true. I took him for 2300 & 2301 and loved him. I've learned so much in these two classes. He is also funny but sometimes unclear. Overall: He works for some people and dosen't for others.

Firment does not include much description of assignments nor any real course schedule in his syllabus. He seems to take pleasure when his explanations confuse. He smiles when students become frustrated with material. Firment sometimes teaches backwards, the last concept first and the intro concept last. He takes joy in creating stress in students.

One of the most arcane and obtuse teachers I have ever met. He is quite unable to see the inadequcy of the materials he uses. His answers to straighforward questions make the answer even more unclear. His attitude towards enabling students is one of feigned sympathy. Takes pride in being smarter than students. One of the most impotent teachers ever

Dr. Firment has a lot of personality, his tests are not easy, but he lets you redo incorrect answers worth 3/4 of the original points, I really enjoyed his class.  He is laid back and very approachable, a very nice professor, I would definately take him over again. An A or B is attainable.
Hard class, but the teacher is funny and very nice. He's a little vague and so is the syllabus but other than that he was a good teacher.
Dr. Firment is great! He has a laid-back style, but I still learned a lot and enjoyed his class. He's very nice and always willing to help if you find something to be unclear.
Try to avoid this one.  He is not very clear on assignments and his teaching technique is a little vague BUT if you read the book you should be in pretty good shape for his tests.
